instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
So the IO board was completely dead with no usb whatsoever, after replacing it, the USB is back but wifi still not working, wifi card tested good on another computer. 

where should I look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Check L9501 and <CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33.

Bluetooth works?
Did you try another RIO flex?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Tried another RIO flex, same.
Bluetooth works.

L9501 is ok. Continuity is ok and diode mode to ground reading is 227.

<CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33, no short across.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
L9501 is ok. Continuity is ok and diode mode to ground reading is 227.

<CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33, no short across. did i check this right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Checked continuity from <CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33 and L9501 to J9510?
Also check continuity between MLB and RIO boards, for airport lines (flex connected, of course).
Compare diode mode readings on airport related lines with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Continuity from <CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33 and L9501 to J9510 are OK.

Diode mode reading of:
<SIGNAL>PCIE_AP_D2R_N</SIGNAL> = 330
<SIGNAL>PCIE_AP_D2R_P</SIGNAL> = 330
<SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_AP_CONN_P</SIGNAL> = 240
<SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_AP_CONN_N</SIGNAL> = 240
<SIGNAL>PCIE_AP_R2D_N</SIGNAL> = open (diode mode reading kept at 1)
<SIGNAL>PCIE_AP_R2D_P</SIGNAL> = open (diode mode reading kept at 1)

is this normal? I dont have another good board to compare.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Check on the other side of the caps.
Is normal to get OL on the connector side, once no airport card is connected.
Don't forget the lines from pins 22 & 24 of J9510.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
pin 22 & 24 of J9510 diode mode to ground reading is 427
After connected airport card, <SIGNAL>PCIE_AP_R2D_N</SIGNAL> & P both have values.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode on the other side of <CAPACITOR>C9532</CAPACITOR>/33?
I forgot to mention pins 52 and 54.

Once RIO board is connected (airport card inserted), check voltages at pins 22, 24, 52, 64 (J9510).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message: sorry for a stupid question.. i have the board out of the case(but with RIO board connected), how do I start the board? (magsafe is orange and mouse no led)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
All iCore Macbook boards start automatically when charger is plugged in; if no battery connected.
You can also use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
All iCore Macbook boards start automatically when charger is plugged in; if no battery connected.

^^ I dont have battery plugged in, but how come the usb mouse has no led if it automatically start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
i got it to start by putting it back onto the case just to make sure i didnt accidentally fry it or something.. it starts..

Now when I measure voltage on the RIO:

<SIGNAL>AP_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_WLAN_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v
<SIGNAL>WIFI_EVENT_L</SIGNAL> on the RIO board and it is giving 3.1v.. is this abnormal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with dead IO board (no usb, no wifi), replaced IO board but wifi still not working
threads.message:
You don't get USB activity on RIO board?
The USB port from MLB also not working?

No idea about <SIGNAL>WIFI_EVENT_L</SIGNAL>; compare with working board.

"You can also use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button."
You don't need to put the board back on the shell to start.

BTW, machine automatically starts if you connect proper charger; Magsafe 2 original 60/85W in this case.
